question: Classification is not a single step process but involves ______ of steps.
Each step in the classification hierarchy represents a rank or ______.
The category is a part of overall ______ arrangement.
All categories together constitute the taxonomic ______.
Each category in taxonomy is referred to as a unit of ______.
Each rank is commonly termed as ______.
Insects share common features like three pairs of ______ legs.
Insects represent a group of organisms sharing common ______.
Groups represent ______ in taxonomy.
Category further denotes a ______ in taxonomy.
Taxonomic groups or categories are distinct ______ entities.
Taxonomical studies of organisms led to development of common ______.
Taxonomic categories include kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus and ______.
In plants, the term ‘division’ is used instead of ______.
All organisms have ______ as the lowest category.
To place an organism in categories, knowledge of ______ is required.
Identifying similarities and dissimilarities among organisms helps in ______.
Taxonomic studies consider a group of individual organisms with fundamental ______ as a species.
Species can be distinguished based on distinct ______ differences.
In Mangifera indica, the word ‘indica’ represents the ______ epithet.
In Solanum tuberosum, the word ‘Solanum’ is the ______.
In Panthera leo, ‘leo’ is the specific ______.
Each genus may have more than one specific ______.
The genus Panthera includes the species ______.
The genus Solanum includes species like nigrum and ______.
Human beings belong to the species ______.
The genus of human beings is ______.
The scientific name of human being is ______.
In handwritten biological names, both words are separately ______.
Each taxon represents a unit of ______.
Morphological similarities are used to group species under one ______.
Taxonomic studies are based on observable ______.
A taxon is a distinct biological ______.
Taxa can be at very different ______.
Solanum tuberosum is the scientific name of ______.
Panthera leo is the scientific name of ______.
Taxonomy includes characterisation, identification, classification, and ______.
Each rank or category is commonly referred to as a ______.
All taxonomic categories form the taxonomic ______.
Biological categories like ‘family’, ‘genus’ and ‘species’ are part of the ______ system.
The scientific name of mango is ______.
The lowest category in taxonomic hierarchy is ______.
Characters of individuals help to identify ______ among organisms.
Characters of individuals also help to identify ______ among organisms.
Each genus can include multiple ______ with similar morphology.
‘Indica’, ‘tuberosum’, and ‘leo’ are all examples of ______ epithets.
Taxonomic studies aim to classify organisms based on ______ differences.
Panthera and Solanum are examples of biological ______.
The genus Panthera includes both leo and ______.
